title: Start
body:
Boy Band Academy Dormitories, Early Morning.
Aig: Alright man, get your shit together.
<<flip Aig>><<move Aig CenterStage>>
Aig: Today's the big day! The day you finally get your big break!  
Aig: The day you finally make something out of your pathetic life!
Aig: The day you become...
Aig: ...
Aig: ...
Aig: I don't know...something.
Aig: Something great!
Aig: ...
Aig: ...or something.
Aig: ...
Aig: Man, what am I talking about?
Lee: Hey, Aig. Having a nice conversation with the mirror?
Aig: Lee?!
<<flip Aig>><<move Aig StageLeft2>><<move Lee StageRight2>>
Lee: Good morning.
Aig: H-how long have you been standing there!?
Lee: Long enough. Pretty much the whole time, actually.
Lee: You were really getting into it there, huh?
Aig: Oh man...so embarassing.
Lee: Ha ha! Relax, man! 
Lee: I think it's actually pretty cute! The way you psyche yourself up.
Aig: Is that...a good thing?
Lee: What, being cute?
Aig: Yeah.
Lee shrugs
Lee: Dunno. It is if you want it to be, I guess.
->I can be cute.
    Aig: I guess I can be the cute one, right?
    Lee: Sure. It's an angle. 
    Lee: It'll get you pretty far in this business, that's for sure.
    Aig: Hmmm. Maybe.
->I don't want to be cute!
    Aig: But I don't want to be cute!
    Lee: Well, then stop talking to yourself in the mirror. It's too cute!
    Aig: Ha ha! Yeah I guess so.
*KNOCK KNOCK KNOCK*
Lee: She's here.
<<move Kent StageLeft2>><<flip Aig>><<move Aig StageRight2>><<move Lee StageRight1>>
Kent: Good morning, boys.
Aig & Lee: Good morning, Miss Kent.
She looks around.
Kent: Where's Jaypee?
Aig: Dunno.
Lee: Who's to say.
Kent: *sigh*
Kent: I should really keep that boy on a leash, shouldn't I?
Jaypee: Oh relax, would you?
<<move Jaypee CenterStage>>
Jaypee: I'm here. No need to freak out.
Kent: Nice of you to join us this morning, Jaypee.
Jaypee: Yeah, yeah.
Lee: Where were you?
Jaypee holds up a large plastic cup.
Jaypee: Coffee.  You know I can't start my day without my Double Triple Vente Trenti Caramel Mocha Macchiato.
Kent: Riiiight. Of course.
Jaypee: Miss Kent, you wouldn't believe what happened at the coffee shop!
Jaypee: This whole group of girls recognized me from the poster!
Jaypee: They all lined up, asked me for autographs, tried to take selfies with me, everything!
Jaypee: They were totally freaking out!
Kent: Good, that means the marketing has been working.
Kent: This is exactly the kind of buzz we want leading up to this weekend.
Kent: Speaking of which, let's get down to business.
Kent: As of today, you are all officially graduates.
Kent: Which means you are no longer students at Boy Band Academy and I am no longer your teacher.
Kent: From now on, you are clients of the Boy Band Entertainment Conglomerate, and I am your manager!
Aig: Does this mean we're officially a band?
Kent: Technically speaking, yes.
Lee: Nice!
Jaypee: Swag.
Kent: Don't get too excited yet, boys. You still haven't even played your first gig.
Aig: Oh...right.
Kent: As you know, we've spent the last few months preparing for your big debut this weekend.
Kent: Don't worry, I've taken care of everything. The venue's booked, ticket are selling, I've even got some merchandise lined up.
Aig: So what should we do?
Kent: Whatever you want. I'm not your teacher anymore. I'm not going to tell you what you can and can't do.
Kent: From now on, I leave it to you to determine your own schedules.
Kent: However, I suggest you use the next three days wisely.
Kent: Don't neglect practice. You boys have talent, but you could still brush up your vocals and choreography.
Kent: You could also spend some time doing a little self-promoting. We've got the word out on Social Media, and the posters we've put around town are clearly doing their job...
Jaypee: Clearly.
Kent: ...but we're not sold out yet. If you boys want a successful debut, you've got to make sure people actually show up to it. 
Kent: I don't care if you pass out fliers on the street. Anything to establish your brand.
Kent: But most importantly, make sure you're rested for the show.  I don't want you guys running around town all week just to collapse on stage.
Lee: Of course.
Jaypee: Got it.
Kent: Aig, did you get all that?
->Yes!
    Aig: Yup! I'm ready!
    Kent: Good. Now I all want you to schedule your time carefully.
->So, I can do whatever I want?
    Aig: So I can set up my daily schedule however I want?
    Kent: Yes. It's entirely up to you. But I suggest you plan carefully.
Kent: This is your big debut.  And as we all know, 95% of all boy bands don't make it past their first performance.
Kent: But if you guys fail, it will reflect poorly on the company, the academy, and most importantly, me.
Kent: So if I feel like you guys aren't ONE HUNDRED PERCENT ready in three days time, I will pull the plug on this whole thing.
Kent: No concert. No debut. No career. Am I clear?
Lee: Yes ma'am.
Jaypee: Crystal.
Aig. Y-yes.
Kent: Good. 
<<flip Jaypee>><<move Jaypee StageLeft1>>
Jaypee: Tch! The way those girls were fawning over me at the coffee shop, I don't think we have anything to worry about.
Jaypee: Now if you'll excuse me, I have to go work on establishing my personal brand.
<<flip Jaypee>>
Jaypee: Later, bitches!
<<move Jaypee OffStageLeft>>
Lee: Well, he certainly seems confident.
<<move Lee CenterStage>><<flip Lee>>
Lee: Though rightfully so, I guess.  We've all been working hard these past few years. 
Lee: There's no reason why we shouldn't succeed.
Lee: Still, can't hurt to be prepared. I going to make sure I'm ready for this weekend.
<<flip Lee>>
Lee: Catch you later, Aig.
Aig: Yeah, see ya.
<<move Lee OffStageLeft>><<move Aig StageRight1>>
Aig: I better get going too.
Kent: Actually, Aig, I wanted to talk to you for a second.
Aig: Um, okay. What's up.
Kent: To be quite blunt, Aig, I'm not sure where you fit in this band.
Aig: What do you mean?
Kent: How do I put this.
Kent: When a fan looks at a Boy Band, they like to see strong, indetifiable personalities that are easy to connect with.
Kent: For instance, Jaypee is an unpredictable but charasmatic hearthrob with a bit of a wild side.
Kent: And Lee is the strong, sensitive leader who truly cares about the music.
Kent: Boom. Those right there are two big personalities that are easy to pick out of a line up.
Kent: But when I look at you, I don't see anything in particular. 
Kent: To me, you're just...I don't know.  Some guy.
Aig: Just...some guy?
Kent: Exactly! You're...how do I put this...
Kent: You're handsome, but you're not gorgeous. 
Kent: You're talented, but you're not a prodigy.
Kent: You're funny, but you're not hilarious.
Kent: You're nice, but you're not Ghandi.
Kent: Do you see what I'm saying?
->Yeah.
    Aig: Yeah...I think so.
->Am I cute?
    Aig: Well..am I cute?
    Kent: Uh...
    Kent: Well, yeah...
    Kent: But you're not adorable.
    Aig: Oh...
Kent: Look, Aig, you were able to coast through the Academy on you're mediocrity, but your career will die in the cradle if you don't start carving out a niche for yourself.
Kent: I want you to really focus on making yourself stand out.
Kent: If you want to succeed in this industry, you can't get away with being just a person any more. You have to be a personALITY. You get me?
Aig: Y-yeah. I get you.
Kent: Good! 
<<flip Kent>>
Kent: Now you better get to filling out your schedule for the day! Remember, only three days to the big 'Debut'! With a capital 'D'!
Aig: Right...
<<flip Kent>>
Kent: Oh, and Aig, one more thing.
Aig: Yes?
Kent: Don't forget to have fun, okay?
Aig: Uh, yeah...okay.
Kent: Greeaaaat! See you in three days!
<<flip Kent>><<move Kent OffStageLeft>><<move Aig CenterStage>>
Aig: Oh, man...I better get to work.
